definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: The son overthrew father, but he would be repenting forever and crime sense followed the son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子推翻父亲，但伴随儿子的将是永远忏悔和罪恶感。

sentences.english: Humans have a natural aversion to those who are ill.
sentences.chinese: 人类对于生病的人有一种天然的厌恶感。

sentences.english: How to get rid of the guilt feeling?
So perhaps guilt is good after all.
sentences.chinese: 归根到底，也许罪恶感是个好东西。

sentences.english: Guilt is not a Godly place to be.
sentences.chinese: 罪恶感并不代表敬神与虔诚。

sentences.english: "This is to show I have no ill feelings towards her," she said.
sentences.chinese: “这是表明我对她没有恶感，”她表示说。

sentences.english: Heed your hunger pangs, but forget the guilt.
sentences.chinese: 关注了饥饿感却忽视了罪恶感。

sentences.english: We give to alleviate guilt and repair our self-image.
sentences.chinese: 为了减轻罪恶感和重修自我形象而付出。

sentences.english: And that, I believe, is what true redemption is, Amir jan, when guilt leads to good.
sentences.chinese: 而真正的赎罪是从罪恶感中走向良善。

sentences.english: So, from the very beginning, he bred bad feeling in the house;
sentences.chinese: 所以，一开始，他就在这家里惹起了恶感。

sentences.english: I have every reason in the world to think ill of you.
sentences.chinese: 我有足够的理由对你怀着恶感。

sentences.english: You ought to apologize and show there is no ill feeling between you .
sentences.chinese: 你应当道歉，表明你们之间并无恶感。

sentences.english: Sinburning is also a monthly ceremony where your anonymous confession is annihilated by fire.
sentences.chinese: 罪恶感的消除也将是一个你每月浴火重生的典礼。

sentences.english: Mary tried to poison her husband's mind against his sister.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽试图使她丈夫对他妹妹产生恶感。

sentences.english: This is akin to a robotic model of guilt, Arkin says.
sentences.chinese: Arkin说，这好比一个有罪恶感的机器人模型。

sentences.english: Any ill-feeling has to be nipped in the bud .
sentences.chinese: 必须把一切恶感消灭于萌芽状态之中。

definition: to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
